channel.title: Teches on Mike Johnson
channel.description: Recent content in Teches on Mike Johnson

item.title: DeepMind Health
item.description: I was involved with DeepMind Health from its very early days. As I’m under NDA, I can’t go into details here. This is a shame, as DeepMind Health has been quite successful. We produced the Streams application as well as some notable research output on the subject of computerised analysis of retinal imaging paper available here. DeepMind Health eventually became part of the new Google Health effort. My role was focused around providing infrastructure for us to start handling data in the right way for us, the NHS, and its patients.

item.title: Learning about HPC in Durham - The IPPP
item.description: When I worked in Durham, one of my jobs was with the Institute for Particle Physics Phenomenology. While working with the scientists at the IPPP, I looked after scientific compute clusters, group computing services, and Linux desktops. It was here that I had the honour of sitting with the group’s scientists as CERN announced the discovery of the Higgs Boson. This is a moment I won’t ever forget, and my time at the IPPP gave me a respect for scientific research, and those who devote their lives to it, that will last me a lifetime.

item.title: Poking around the HOPI HP-9800
item.description: Playing with the HOPI HP-9800 Here’s a link to the GitHub repository I recently bought one of these power analysers from eBay after seeing it used by Big Clive on his YouTube channel. Once it arrived, I spotted a MicroUSB port on the top edge. Plugging in a cable and trying to connect achieved absolutely nothing, so I did a little reading and took it as an excuse to learn more Go.
